Topic.Title: Google's big event on October 29: a FULL plate.....

Message.Msg: I don't see that as a negative. Nvidia positions itself at the premium end of the market, and it has served them well so far. They grew up in the video car business, where the rush to the bottom put half of their competitors out of business each generation. Not having a SoC priced for a $99 device is consistent. Is it possible to have a well-supported chip and make a profit at a sub-$10 selling price? That's what the SoC likely costs in a $100 device. $2-$4 of that goes to ARM for a core and GPU license, and $5+ for the chip and packaging. That leaves very little money for the design team, and no margin for the high cost of re-spinning a flawed design. I don't see $100 tablets as a profitable business for a SoC vendor. Only ARM and TSMC make money. Even $200 tablets only make sense if the chip is used in millions of them before an update is needed. Compare that to the automotive market, where Nvidia is quietly piling up design wins. The modules have higher reliability requirements, but you can sell the same high-margin design for a year or two, and keep the business for a decade.

Topic.Title: What? - The market doesn't like what Apple has to say?

Message.Msg: AAPL event was a driver of NVDA today. A little after 10am Apple showed that the new 13" retina display macbook pro have integrated intel graphics instead of discrete cards... which was a let down. Then they showed the updated mac mini, which have also given up discrete GPUs in favor of integrated Intel graphics. Then about 5 minutes later Apple announced the new iMac and confirmed that both had NVDA discrete graphics, sending NVDA back up to a high of the day. I'm cautiously optimistic. This may just be weak shorts getting out.

Message.Title: apple refresh - terrible news for NVDA?
Message.Msg: Apple is now using Intel HD 4000 - put a fork in NVDA. Its destined to go down like MRVL and trade at book value.

Topic.Title: apple refresh - terrible news for NVDA?

Message.Msg: it was a let down that Apple dropped discrete GPUs from their higher end 13" macbook pros and mac minis, but it's great for Nvidia that Apple confirmed their position in the new iMacs. This means Nvidia is in both the 15" macbook pro with retina display as well as the new iMacs, and that Nvidia has indeed won back all of the discrete GPU positions from AMD.

Topic.Title: apple refresh - terrible news for NVDA?

Message.Msg: sure its saving grace for now - but the trend is moving towards integrated solutions. It may not surprise me if Intel is able to completely displace discrete GPU next time around. I hope NVDA can make some noise and gain some share with ARM Surface

Topic.Title: apple refresh - terrible news for NVDA?

Message.Msg: Please, give me a break on the doom for Nvidia because they are in the iMac and the 15" notebook, basically where Apple HAS to use a better graphics engine and that's Nvidia. I think all the news from Apple to helps Nvidia because the Surface will even be more attractive now as well as the Nexus 7 tablet and Google's updates on October 29th. They are using Nvidia in place of AMD in critical places for their featured desktop and laptop designs (larger screens) and making the Android tablets (smaller format) even more attractive by how they are handling the pricing on their 'mini'. So, stick a fork in your comment . .

Topic.Title: Not going to warn

Message.Msg: You really don't understand how discrete graphics works, do you? Also the channel check is not an adequate reflection of what Nvidia is making with AMD's losses being Nvidia's gain. They ALREADY have given an announcement AFTER the last ER that was late enough to consider what is happening now and they were saying then they can't make enough of the Kepler based chips to meet the demand. So I 'spose there can be some surprise warning lower, but you seem to be preoccupied with one stat without looking at the places where Nvidia has been and also reiterated they are doing well. The channel check doesn't measure attach rates or where the real losses of the competitors are going and AMD isn't about to admit Nvidia is taking their share.

Topic.Title: apple refresh - terrible news for NVDA?
